I'm not trying to, but this suggestion was outright stupid....my problem with pantheon is when I play a melee champ I can't go near my minions because hes zoning me, generally the outcome is always the same, I enter lane, try to farm, get level 1 ganked by the jungler (resulting in me burning my flash) and from that point on the lane belongs to pantheon

His main weakness is that he falls off late game harder than most top laners, but of course at the cost of having one of the most powerful top laning phase. If you manage to survive the early game and avoid giving him kills for him to snowball you pretty much done your job to beat him later. As a {{champion:75}} top, I normally start with Spirit Fire and a {{item:1056}} to get some farm and poke. I know it slows me down from stacking Siphoning Strike, but either way Nasus builds armor with cdr. Pantheon would either have to counter build me to win the lane instead of going the typical lethality build to snowball, but if it gets to a point he can't kill me, since Wither destroys most AD champs, he pretty much becomes irrelevant. I think {{champion:14}} may also do well against him since he can stack HP infinitely but I'm not quite sure on that. I know old {{champion:98}} used to do well against him too, but now I don't know. Maybe {{champion:31}} would be a good option too. He has range and sustain and is more disruptive plus he stacks health making it harder for Pantheon to assassinate.
The problem is when it is a good pantheon he doesn't have time to fall off as their usually ending around the 18-22 minute mark, due to pantheon being so massive due to his unopposed laning phase

Then what you do is wait for his inevitable rework and support ideas people propose that could elongate the game so your odds of Riot maybe implementing some of them is increased and the games go on long enough for a late-game to exist. 

Or you pick champions that attempt to sustain regardless and don't bank on a huge early presence, like the aforementioned Nasus, Sion, Cho'gath... Karma top can also do well against him because she can harass him and she sustains herself fairly well with shields and heals, and with her root she's not bad with a gank either. Even better if she happens upon a blue buff given to her but obviously don't bank on that in top lane. Then you have someone like Swain who has good sustain and can keep himself going and will outscale Pantheon pretty quickly. There's options, they just aren't all the most obvious options. He doesn't like high sustain champions, and he isn't a fan of tanks that scale as the game goes on because they become an insurmountable obstacle to him--bonus points for the scaling tank because his team will probably blame him for not keeping you down.

> Debatable I have won against pantheon many times with fiora, you can counter his stun with your W.

Only if he's dumb enough to not 1) use his stun when Riposte is down, or 2) use his stun in pointblank range where it is literally impossible to react too, although the second one can be mindgamed.

The fact is Pantheon doesn't need to W in order to win a duel against Fiora unless there is a cannon minion nearby (in which case it won't help much either). If Fiora wants to fight Pantheon early game, she needs to tank his entire minion wave in order to do so, combined with Fiora's only moderate-above average DPS means that's impossible. Especially if Panth is running DFT, although Tlords is fine too.

And if she doesn't bully you out early game, or at least zone you, then you will bully her out to the point where she either Ripostes your Q, takes 1/3 of her health in damage, or gives up every last CS.

The only real counterplay available to either of them is to utilize the cannon minions to proc Panth's passive.
